TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IPGlobalStatistics extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides Internet Protocol (IP) statistical data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetIPv4GlobalStatistics%2A> and <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetIPv6GlobalStatistics%2A> methods to return IP traffic information.
The Internet protocol is used to move IP packets from a source computer to a destination computer. IP also handles dividing a packet that is too large into multiple packets that are small enough for transport, in a process known as fragmentation.
The properties in this class correlate to the Management Information Base objects for IP defined in IETF RFC 2011.
## Examples The following code example displays IP statistics.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfoReport#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CPP/netinfo.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfoReport#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CS/netinfo.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be called only by classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalStatistics>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DefaultTtl As Integer
public: abstract property int DefaultTtl { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the default time-to-live (TTL) value for Internet Protocol (IP) packets.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the TTL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TTL value is reported as the number of routing nodes that can forward a packet before it is discarded. Each node decrements the current TTL value in a packet before forwarding it. If the TTL value reaches zero, the packet is deemed undeliverable and is discarded. Note that when a packet travels from one node to another, this is also known as a "hop".
## Examples The following code example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#14)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#14)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#14)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ForwardingEnabled As Boolean
public: abstract property bool ForwardingEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether Internet Protocol (IP) packet forwarding is enabled.
Docs.value: A value that specifies whether packet forwarding is enabled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This value determines whether the computer forwards IP datagrams destined for another computer. Typically, routers forward packets and host computers do not.
## Examples The following code example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#14)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#14)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#14)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property NumberOfInterfaces As Integer
public: abstract property int NumberOfInterfaces { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of network interfaces.
Docs.value: An value containing the number of network interfaces for the address family used to obtain this instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data returned by this property includes loopback interfaces.
Network interfaces are also known as network adapters.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property NumberOfIPAddresses As Integer
public: abstract property int NumberOfIPAddresses { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) addresses assigned to the local computer.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the number of IP addresses assigned to the address family (Internet Protocol version 4 or Internet Protocol version 6) described by this object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data returned by this property includes addresses of pseudo network interfaces such as tunnels.
If this instance was obtained by calling <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetIPv4GlobalStatistics%2A>, this property returns the number of IPv4 addresses assigned to the local computer. Similarly, if this instance was obtained by calling <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPGlobalProperties.GetIPv6GlobalStatistics%2A>, this property returns the number of IPv6 addresses assigned to the local computer.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property NumberOfRoutes As Integer
public: abstract property int NumberOfRoutes { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of routes in the Internet Protocol (IP) routing table.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of routes in the routing table.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OutputPacketRequests As Long
public: abstract property long OutputPacketRequests { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of outbound Internet Protocol (IP) packets.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of outgoing packets.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The number of outbound packets does not include the number of packets that have been forwarded.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for outbound IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#17)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#17)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OutputPacketRoutingDiscards As Long
public: abstract property long OutputPacketRoutingDiscards { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of routes that have been discarded from the routing table.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of valid routes that have been discarded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks One possible reason for discarding a valid routing table entry could be to free buffer space for other entries.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for outbound IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#17)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#17)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OutputPacketsDiscarded As Long
public: abstract property long OutputPacketsDiscarded { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of transmitted Internet Protocol (IP) packets that have been discarded.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of outgoing packets that have been discarded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data returned by this property does not include packets discarded because of errors that made the packets undeliverable. Packets included in this data are typically discarded due to network issues, such as insufficient buffer space.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for outbound IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#17)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#17)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OutputPacketsWithNoRoute As Long
public: abstract property long OutputPacketsWithNoRoute { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets for which the local computer could not determine a route to the destination address.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the number of packets that could not be sent because a route could not be found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks IP packets that fall into this category are discarded.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for outbound IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#17)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#17)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketFragmentFailures As Long
public: abstract property long PacketFragmentFailures { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets that could not be fragmented.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of packets that required fragmentation but had the "Don't Fragment" bit set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination. The value returned by this property indicates the number of packets that needed to be fragmented for IP transport but could not be because the packet header specified that the packet not be fragmented.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketReassembliesRequired As Long
public: abstract property long PacketReassembliesRequired { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets that required reassembly.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of packet reassemblies required.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketReassemblyFailures As Long
public: abstract property long PacketReassemblyFailures { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets that were not successfully reassembled.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of packets that could not be reassembled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination. If some fragments are lost or do not arrive within a set time, the reassembly does not succeed.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketReassemblyTimeout As Long
public: abstract property long PacketReassemblyTimeout { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum amount of time within which all fragments of an Internet Protocol (IP) packet must arrive.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the maximum number of milliseconds within which all fragments of a packet must arrive to avoid being discarded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination. If all fragments that make up a fragmented IP packet do not arrive within the allowed time, the packet is discarded.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketsFragmented As Long
public: abstract property long PacketsFragmented { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets fragmented.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of fragmented packets.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property PacketsReassembled As Long
public: abstract property long PacketsReassembled { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets reassembled.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of fragmented packets that have been successfully reassembled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Session layer packets that exceed the maximum size for IP transport are broken into fragments and reassembled at the destination. If some fragments are lost or do not arrive within a set time, the reassembly does not succeed.
## Examples The following code example displays reassembly statistics for IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#18)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPackets As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPackets { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of IP packets received.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value returned by this property includes packets received in error.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#15)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsDelivered As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsDelivered { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets delivered.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of IP packets delivered.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value returned by this property includes Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#15)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsDiscarded As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsDiscarded { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets that have been received and discarded.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of incoming packets that have been discarded.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value returned by this property includes only those packets that were discarded even though they did not contain errors that prevented reassembly or delivery. Typically, packets in this category are discarded because of insufficient buffer space.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#15)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsForwarded As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsForwarded { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets forwarded.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of forwarded packets.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the local computer is not a router, the value returned by this property includes packets that were successfully source-routed via the local computer. Source routing is an IP option whereby the source of the packet can specify the route to the destination address.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#15)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#15)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsWithAddressErrors As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsWithAddressErrors { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets with address errors that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of IP packets received with errors in the address portion of the header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value returned by this property includes packets discarded for address related issues in the header fields, such as invalid addresses. If packet forwarding is not enabled, the value returned by this property includes packets that were discarded because the destination address was not a local address.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets with errors.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#16)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#16)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsWithHeadersErrors As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsWithHeadersErrors { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets with header errors that were received.
Docs.value: An value that specifies the total number of IP packets received and discarded due to errors in the header.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value returned by this property includes packets discarded for non-address related issues in the header fields, such as bad checksums, time-to-live value exceeded, and incorrect IP options.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets with errors.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#16)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#16)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ReceivedPacketsWithUnknownProtocol As Long
public: abstract property long ReceivedPacketsWithUnknownProtocol { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of Internet Protocol (IP) packets received on the local machine with an unknown protocol in the header.
Docs.value: An value that indicates the total number of IP packets received with an unknown protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The protocol field in the IP header indicates the next-level protocol used in the data portion of the IP datagram. If the protocol is not recognized, the data cannot be passed to the correct application.
## Examples The following code example displays statistics for received IP packets with errors.
[!code-cpp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#16)] [!code-vb[NCLNetInfo2#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#16)]
